pull.title: doc: use llvm-config for bitcoin-tidy example
pull.body: An LLVM installation will have `llvm-config` available to query for info. Ask it for the `--libdir`, and use that in our bitcoin-tidy example, rather than listing multiple different (potential) paths per distro/OS etc.

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

issue.title: ci: Integrate `bitcoin-tidy` clang-tidy plugin
issue.body:
Demo of integrating the [bitcoin-tidy](https://github.com/theuni/bitcoin-tidy-plugin), [clang-tidy plugin](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/) written by theuni into our tidy CI job.

The plugin currently has a single check, `bitcoin-unterminated-logprintf`. This would replace our current Python driven, `git-grep`-based, `.cpp` file only, lint-logs linter.

verification.payload:
tree ecc08bec2700edd99569906cc12cffff6177c162
parent 492257019d6d6e0f4051433e510502e8040fd6d2
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1691582600 +0200
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1691663975 +0200

doc: use llvm-config for bitcoin-tidy example

An LLVM installation will have `llvm-config` available to query for
info. Ask it for the `--cmakedir`, and use that in our bitcoin-tidy
example, rather than listing multiple different (potential) paths per
distro/OS etc.

events.message:
doc: use llvm-config for bitcoin-tidy example

An LLVM installation will have `llvm-config` available to query for
info. Ask it for the `--cmakedir`, and use that in our bitcoin-tidy
example, rather than listing multiple different (potential) paths per
distro/OS etc.

events.body: Simplifed this further, given we can actually just ask for `llvm-config --cmakedir`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,6 +3,9 @@
 Example Usage:
 
 ```bash
-cmake -S . -B build -DLLVM_DIR=/path/to/lib/cmake/llvm -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release
-make -C build -j$(nproc)
+cmake -S . -B build -DLLVM_DIR=$(llvm-config --libdir)/cmake/llvm -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release
+
+cmake --build build -j$(nproc)
comments.body:
Concept ACK on improving the example usage. Any tips on how to make it work with macOS 13.5 arm64? Seeing `Undefined symbols for architecture arm64` errors at this step in both versions of this README (thanks!)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,6 +3,9 @@
 Example Usage:
 
 ```bash
-cmake -S . -B build -DLLVM_DIR=/path/to/lib/cmake/llvm -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release
-make -C build -j$(nproc)
+cmake -S . -B build -DLLVM_DIR=$(llvm-config --libdir)/cmake/llvm -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release
+
+cmake --build build -j$(nproc)
comments.body: Use vanilla LLVM/Clang, Not Apple LLVM/Clang.
